intro: Campanula stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-capsule bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy surface, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Campanula stenocarpa is well adapted to rocky and dry soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
